details.headline: Type
Instance method
details.summary: Adds a tag to a file.
details.description: A tag can only be added to a file once. It is not possible to specify a color for the tag. You can create the tags using the Files app to specify the color and then add them to files afterwards using the FileManager API. The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to add the tag to.

infos.title: tag
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Tag to add. This can be an existing tag or a new tag.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Reads all extended attributes on a file.
details.description: Extended attributes are metadata that can be stored on a file. Note that extended attributes are not synced with iCloud.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to read extended attributes from.

infos.subtitle: [string]
infos.description: An array of all extended attributes.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Reads all file bookmarks created in settings.
details.description: File bookmarks are used to bookmark a file or a folder and read or write to it later. File bookmarks are created from Scriptables settings. This function returns all file bookmarks as an array of objects that take the following form. { "name": "My Bookmark", "source": "host" } The source can either be host for file bookmarks that can be used in the app or siri_shortcuts for file bookmarks that can be used in Siri and Shortcuts.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Reads all tags from a file.
details.description: The tags are read from the file at the specified path. Tags can either be read, added and removed using the Files app by using the APIs provided by a FileManager. The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to read tags from.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Get path to a bookmarked file or folder.
details.description:
Gets the path to a bookmarked file or filder. Use file bookmarks to access files and folders outside Scriptables documents directory.

You can edit your file bookmarks from Scriptables settings.

The function will throw an error if the bookmark doesn't exist.

Please beware that bookmarks created from Scriptables settings only can be used when running a script in the app and not from the Share Sheet, Siri and Shortcuts. If you wish to use a bookmark from Siri or the Shortcuts app, the bookmark must be created using Scriptables "Create File Bookmark" shortcut action using the Shortcuts app.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Name of bookmark to create path for.

infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path to the bookmarked file or folder.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Check if a bookmark exists.
details.description:
Checks if a file bookmark exists with the specified name.

You can edit your file bookmarks from Scriptables settings.

Please beware that bookmarks created from Scriptables settings only can be used when running a script in the app and not from the Share Sheet, Siri and Shortcuts. If you wish to use a bookmark from Siri or the Shortcuts app, the bookmark must be created using Scriptables "Create File Bookmark" shortcut action using the Shortcuts app.

infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: True of a bookmark exists for the specified name, otherwise false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Path of cache directory.
details.description:
Used to retrieve the path of a cache directory on disk. 
The operating system may at any time delete files stored in this directory
and therefore you should not rely on it for long time storage.

Data persisted in the cache directory will generally live longer than data persisted in a temporary directory.

If you need long time storage, see documentsDirectory() or libraryDirectory(). This directory is not shared between the app, the action extension and Siri.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Copies a file.
details.description:
Copies the file from the source path to the destination path.
If a file already exists at the destination file path, the operation will fail and the file will not be copied.

infos.title: sourceFilePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of the file to copy.

infos.title: destinationFilePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path to copy the file to.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Creates a directory at the specified path.
details.description: You can optionally create all intermediate directories.

infos.title: intermediateDirectories
infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: Whether to create all intermediate directories. Defaults to false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Reads the creation date of a file.
details.description: The returned value will be null if the creation date cannot be read.

infos.subtitle: Date
infos.description: The date the file was created.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Path of documents directory.
details.description: Used to retrieve the path to the documents directory. Your scripts are stored in this directory. If you have iCloud enabled, your scripts will be stored in the documents directory in iCloud otherwise they will be stored in the local documents directory. The directory can be used for long time storage. Documents stored in this directory can be accessed using the Files app. Files stored in the local documents directory will not appear in the Files app.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Download file from iCloud if necessary.
details.description: Downloads the file from iCloud if it have not already been downloaded. If you pass in a path to a file that is not stored in iCloud, the returned promise will be resolved immediately making it safe to pass in any file path.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to download from iCloud.

infos.subtitle: Promise
infos.description: Promise that is fulfilled when the file have been downloaded.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Checks if the file exists.
details.description: Checks if the file exists at the specified file path. Checking this before moving or copying to a destination can be a good idea as those operations will replace any existing file at the destination file path.

infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: True if the file exists otherwise false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Get extension of a file.
details.description: Takes a file path and returns the extension of the file, e.g. ".jpg" or ".js". Returns en empty string for directories.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to get extension from.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Get name of a file.
details.description:
Takes a file path and returns the name of the file. Also supports getting the name of a directory.
The returned file name optionally includes the extension of the file.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: path of file to get name of.

infos.title: includeFileExtension
infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: Whether or not the file extension should be included. Defaults to false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Size of the file in kilobytes.
details.description: The returned value will be null if the file size cannot be read.

infos.subtitle: number
infos.description: The file size measured in kilobytes.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Gets the UTI of the specified file.
details.description: The Uniform Type Identifier is a string that identifies the type of file.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to get UTI of.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Creates an iCloud FileManager.
details.description: Creates a file manager for operating with files stored in iCloud. iCloud must be enabled on the device in order to use this.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Checks if a path points to a directory.

infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: True if the path points to a directory otherwise false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Checks if a file have been downloaded.
details.description: If a file is stored in iCloud and it has not been downloaded, this function returns false. In that case, the file can be downloaded using downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath. If the file is not stored in iCloud but rather locally on the device, this function returns true. The function returns false if the file does not exist. Check if a file exists using fileExists(filePath)

infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: True if the file have been downloaded otherwise false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Checks if a file is stored in iCloud.
details.description: Checks if a file is stored in iCloud or locally on the device. The function returns false if the file does not exist. Check if a file exists using fileExists(filePath)

infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: True if the file is stored in iCloud otherwise false.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Joins two path components.
details.description: Joins two paths to created one path. For example to join the path to a directory with the name of a file. This is the suggested approach for creating new file paths passed to the read and write functions of a FileManager.

infos.title: lhsPath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Left-hand side part of the new path.

infos.title: rhsPath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Right-hand side part of the new path.

infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path with the two path components joined.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Path of library directory.
details.description: Used to retrieve the path to the library directory. The directory can be used for long time storage. Documents stored in this directory cannot be accessed using the Files app.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Lists content of directory.
details.description: Lists all the contents in the specified directory. The returned array contains file paths to all files in the directory.

infos.subtitle: [string]
infos.description: File paths to all files in the directory.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Creates a local FileManager.
details.description: Creates a file manager for operating with files stored locally.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Reads the modification date of a file.
details.description: The returned value will be null if the modification date cannot be read.

infos.subtitle: Date
infos.description: The date the file was last modified.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Moves a file.
details.description:
Moves the file from the source path to the destination path.
Caution: This operation will replace any existing file at the the destination.

infos.title: sourceFilePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of the file to move.

infos.title: destinationFilePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path to move the file to.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Read contents of a file as data.
details.description: Reads the contents of the file specified by the file path as raw data. To read the file as a string see readString(filePath) and to read it as an image see readImage(filePath). The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of the file to read.

infos.subtitle: Data
infos.description: Contents of the file as a data or null if the file could not be read.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Reads an extended attribute from a file.
details.description: Extended attributes are metadata that can be stored on a file. Note that extended attributes are not synced with iCloud. The function will return null if the attribute does not exist. The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to read extended attribute from.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Name of the extended attribute to read.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Read contents of a file as an image.
details.description: Reads the contents of the file specified by the file path and converts it to an image. The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of the file to read.

infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: Contents of the file as an image or null if the file could not be read.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Read contents of a file as string.
details.description: The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of the file to read.

infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Contents of the file as a string or null if the file could not be read.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Removes a file.
details.description: Removes the file at the specified path. Use with caution. Removed files cannot be restored.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Removes an extended attribute from a file.
details.description: Extended attributes are metadata that can be stored on a file. Note that extended attributes are not synced with iCloud. The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to add an extended attribute to.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Name of the extended attribute to remove.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Removes a tag from a file.
details.description: The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to remove the tag from.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Path of temporary directory.
details.description:
Used to retrieve the path of a temporary directory on disk. 
Data persisted in a temporary directory will generally live shorter than data persisted in the cache directory.

The operating system may at any time delete files stored in this directory
and therefore you should not rely on it for long time storage.
If you need long time storage, see documentsDirectory() or libraryDirectory(). This directory is not shared between the app, the action extension and Siri.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Write data to a file.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to write to.

details.headline: Instance method
details.decleration: writeExtendedAttribute(filePath: string, value: string, name: string)
details.summary: Writes an extended attribute to a file.
details.description: Extended attributes are metadata that can be stored on a file. Note that extended attributes are not synced with iCloud. The function will error if the file does not exist or if it exists in iCloud but has not been download. Use fileExists(filePath) to check if a file exists and downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath) to download the file. Note that it is always safe to call downloadFileFromiCloud(filePath), even if the file is stored locally on the device.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to add an extended attribute to.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Name of the extended attribute. This is used to retrieve the value at a later point.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Write an image to a file.
details.description: Writes the image to the specified file path on disk. If the file does not already exist, it will be created. If the file already exists the contents of the file will be overwritten with the new content.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to write to.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Write a string to a file.
details.description: Writes the content to the specified file path on disk. If the file does not already exist, it will be created. If the file already exists the contents of the file will be overwritten with the new content.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of file to write to.

details.summary: Read and write files on disk.
details.description: A FileManager lets you read files stored on the disk and make changes to them. Paths to files are supplied as strings.

details.headline: Type
Instance property
details.subtitle: Size
details.summary: Size of the image in pixels.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Creates an image from raw data.
details.description: Loads an image from the raw data. If the image could not be read, the function will return null.

infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: The read image or null if the image could not be read.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Creates an image from file.
details.description: Loads an image from the specified file path. If the image could not be read, the function will return null.

infos.title: filePath
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: File path to read image from.

infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: The read image or null if the image could not be read.

details.summary: Manages image data.
details.description: Images objects contains image data. APIs in Scriptable that work with images, either by taking an image as input or returning an image, will use this the Image type.

details.headline: Type
Static method
details.summary: Check if keychain contains a key.
details.description: Checks if the keychain contains the specified key.

infos.title: key
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Key to look up in the keychain.

infos.subtitle: bool
infos.description: True if the key exists in the keychain, otherwise false.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Reads a value from the keychain.
details.description: Reads the value for the specified key. If the key doesn't exist the method will throw an error. Used the contains method to check if a key exists in the keychain.

infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Value assigned to the specified key.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Remove key from keychain.

infos.title: key
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Key to remove from the keychain.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Add value for a specified key to keychain.
details.description:
Adds the value to the keychain, assigning it to the specified key. If the key already exists in the keychain, the value is overwritten.

Values are securely stored in an encrypted database.

infos.title: key
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Key which the value should be assigned to.

infos.title: value
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Value to assign to the specified key.

details.summary: Secure storage for credentials.
details.description: The keychain is a secure storage for credentials, keys etc. Use the set() method to add values to the keychain. You can then later use the get() method to retrieve the value.
